summary: For decades, Veterans Affairs has denied most disability claims by Vietnam veterans for 3 conditions associated with exposure to herbicides like Agent Orange. These conditions—which involve nerve damage, skin cysts, and blistering—must have manifested within 1 year of service in Vietnam for VA to presume a connection between the condition and exposure. But claims processors didn't consistently understand what evidence could be used to support...
title: VA Disability: Clearer Claims Processing Guidance Needed for Selected Agent Orange Conditions
